scenarios.name: Minimum settings: Example (all defaults)
description: This demonstrates a minimal invocation of the widget and relies on all of the default settings:
As such it may change as the defaults change.

scenarios.name: No Base Image
description: This demonstrates the base image is not necessary:

scenarios.name: Auto text: Specify 'percentage' and graphic will display the percentage
description: by setting text-overlay to 'percentage' (case insensitive) then a percentage string will be overlaid

scenarios.name: Vertical cropping
description: This demonstrates the use of the vertical cropping feature. The percentage is set to 66%.
The bottom 2/3 of the widget should be image should be blue, and the top 1/2 should be black.

scenarios.name: fully customized
description: This demonstrates all of the available customizations.

text-header.text: Header def is a dict of terms

settings.text-footer: Footer, just a string, uses graphic defaults

scenarios.name: arbitrary css can be added
description: This demonstrates a customization achieved by supplying css strings targeting specific element.

scenarios.name: A graphic that is not resizable
description: It doesnt resize. try it using the controls below

scenarios.name: Multiple Squares Example - Minimal Config
description: This demonstrates a minimal invocation of the widget with multiple images

scenarios.name: Multiple Squares Example - Scale image based on percentage
description: This demonstrates the direction: scale property
Given we still are using a single cell with multiple images we can only specify one percentage.
If we wanted each image to have a specific percentage then we would use a table of multiple cells (each potentially having multiple images),
not a single cell with multiple images

scenarios.name: Multiple Squares Example - Text Header and Footer
description: This demonstrates the use of header and footer text
Notice how the adition of the footer messes with the internal horizontal padding ?!

scenarios.name: Multiple Squares Example - Set DebugBorder to see whats up
description: This demonstrates the use of debugBorder for visual aid
You can see the padding is correct but now the images are being centred to maintain their aspect ratio

scenarios.name: Multiple Squares Example - Add 2x font-size to the height and everything is good
description: This demonstrates that adding height to compensate for the header and footer gets everything back to normal

scenarios.name: Multiple Rectangles Example - Minimal Config
description: This demonstrates a minimal invocation of the widget with multiple images

scenarios.name: Multiple Rectangles Example - Text Header and Footer
description: This demonstrates the use of header and footer text
Notice how the adition of the footer messes with the internal horizontal padding ?!

features.name: Multiple Image Graphic - Forcing num cols or num rows

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - Force 1 Row
description: This demonstrates how to specify the number of rows

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - Force 1 Column
description: This demonstrates how to specify the number of columns

features.name: Multiple Image Graphic - configure inner padding ratios

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - set the inner padding to match the image size
description: A value of 0.5 sets the padding = the image size
For more info, these two parameters sets the padding value of the call to .rangebands : https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Ordinal-Scales#ordinal_rangeBands

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - set the inner padding to 0
description: A value of 0 removes all inner padding
For more info, these two parameters sets the padding value of the call to .rangebands : https://github.com/mbostock/d3/wiki/Ordinal-Scales#ordinal_rangeBands

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - preserveAspectRatio unset or set to 'xMidYMid' (i.e., the defaults)
description: The preserveAspectRatio does not come into play until the image is resized. Try resizing.
Docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/preserveAspectRatio

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - preserveAspectRatio = 'none'
description: The preserveAspectRatio does not come into play until the image is resized. Try resizing.
Docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/preserveAspectRatio

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - preserveAspectRatio = 'xMinYMin'
description: The preserveAspectRatio does not come into play until the image is resized. Try resizing.
Docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/preserveAspectRatio

scenarios.name: Multiple Image Example - preserveAspectRatio = 'xMaxYMax'
description: The preserveAspectRatio does not come into play until the image is resized. Try resizing.
Docs: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/preserveAspectRatio

description: EXPECTED: visually displayed, human readable error. Caused by Setting numRows and numCols at same time (currently a nono).
